Author: heech441

Comment: Trump's deportation program and immigration policies are literally lawless.  The United States is required to accept refugees, regardless of how they entered the country, according to both federal law and international treaty.   Trump is deporting people who were specifically given permission to remain in the United States, via the legal process.  All of those people that were in the videos stacked up on the southern border were trying to enter the United States seeking asylum. All of the stories the Republicans put out about "migrant caravans" were about people who were seeking asylum.   It is the official policy of the Trump Department of Justice that asylum seekers should be deported without receiving a merit hearing, which is the hearing which is intended to determine whether or not their asylum request has merit.   Federal law requires that asylum seekers must be in the United States before they can request asylum. But Republicans in both Texas and Florida have made it an illegal act to enter the country without prior permission.  They then argue that asylum should be denied because the immigrants were in the United States illegally. Except that is exactly how asylum is required to work. By federal law, you cannot apply for asylum without first entering the country.   According to scripture, Jesus Christ was literally crucified in accordance to the laws of the Romans because Pontius Pilate caved to political pressure to put an end to Jesus' disruptive presence because the Roman authorities and the Pharisees felt threatened by him.   But even the Romans gave Jesus a trial before passing judgment.
